text: Flying University (or "Floating University") was a counterculture educational activist group in Warsaw, Poland. They gathered in private apartments to teach history and the Polish language to students.The Baltic Sea Region: Cultures, Politics, Societies, ed. Witold Maciejewski (Uppsala: Baltic University Press, 2002), p. 533 The group operated for 20 years from 1885 to 1905. Warsaw was then under the control of the Russian Empire. Marie Curie became a student here after being banned from Warsaw University because of her sex.The Oxford Encyclopedia of Women in World History, ed. Bonnie G. Smith (Oxford; New York: Oxford University Press, 2008), p. 518 == References == Category:Education in Poland Category:History of Poland Category:Organizations based in Warsaw Category:1885 establishments in Europe Category:19th-century establishments in Poland Category:1900s disestablishments in Europe Category:1880s establishments in Europe
title: Flying University
